question: This team's iconic orange and black colors, adopted in 1947, were inspired by the owner Horace Stoneham's love of hunting and fishing. They hold the record for the most National League pennants, with 23, and have played in 20 World Series. Their home stadium, Oracle Park, boasts stunning views of the San Francisco Bay and is known for its signature splash hits into McCovey Cove. Which team, originally based in New York, moved to San Francisco in 1958 and has won eight World Series championships?
